results.title: Margaree people
results.brief_description: An affectionate look at the people of the Margaree Valley in Cape Breton, Nova Scotia, by a Nantucket Islander and skilled photographer who has come to live among them. George Thomas has documented the rustic character of the Margaree people in an arresting collection of photographs. There, together with live-action scenes filmed in autumn, produce a nostalgic study of a passing way of life.

results.title: Marey
results.brief_description:
In 1862, Etienne-Jules Marey, a French physiologist, with an interest in movement, devised a camera with magazine plates that recorded a series of photographs. Once combined, the pictures would represent movement, and in particluar, the flight of birds. Marey’s invention is regarded as a forerunner of the modermn motion picture camera. See also: ‘Pioneers of Photography’ (Ep.07): ‘The Fleeting Image’ (Available on VHS and 16mm).

Credits: No credits available.

results.title: Mare tranquilitatis
results.creator_credit: Frank Marshall, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
It would be the culmination of John F. Kennedy’s dream. On July 20th 1969, after years of development and training, Apollo 11 - with its team of Neil Armstrong, Edward “Buzz” Aldrin Jr., and Michael Collins - is about to land a man on the moon. The world is watching, and America holds its breath as Neil Armstrong takes “one small step for man - one giant leap for mankind.”

results.title: Marco Solo
results.creator_credit: VCA Film and Television School, University of Melbourne and Adrian Bosich
results.brief_description:
Poor Marco. Accidentally born into an overcrowded Australian-Italian household, he is relegated to his parents’ bedroom. Nine years later, armed with a vivid imagination, an obsession with Dame Edna, and a warped sense of Catholicism, Marco searches for a space of his own. Cast includes Joseph Sollena, Robert Urban, Helen Nicholas, Irini Pappas, Maria Diele.
‘Marco Solo’ screened at many film festivals, including Palm Springs and London International Film Festival.

results.title: Marco Polo's travels
results.creator_credit: Hal Kopel and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Marco Polo wrote a book of his travels in 1298, when he was a POW. He was 17 when he left Venice on his journey. This film tells the story of Marco Polo’s travels to China and back to Europe. An animated map traces his historic journey.
